text: Erigeron porphyrolepis is a Chinese species of flowering plants in the daisy family. It grows on slopes and meadows in Sichuan and Tibet. Erigeron porphyrolepis is a perennial, clumping-forming herb up to 27 cm (11 inches) tall, forming a thick woody rhizomes. Its flower heads have purple ray florets surrounding yellow disc florets.Flora of China, Erigeron porphyrolepis Y. Ling & Y. L. Chen, 1973. 紫苞飞蓬 zi bao fei peng ==References== porphyrolepis Category:Flora of China Category:Plants described in 1842
title: Erigeron porphyrolepis
